channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft -- Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6/4.6.1/4.6.2/4.7/4.7.1/4.7.2
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft -- Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6/4.6.1/4.6.2/4.7/4.7.1/4.7.2

item.title: CVE-2020-16937|2024-08-04T13:45:34.679Z -- microsoft -- microsoft%20.net%20framework%204.6%2F4.6.1%2F4.6.2%2F4.7%2F4.7.1%2F4.7.2
item.description:
An information disclosure vulnerability exists when the .NET Framework improperly handles objects in memory. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could disclose contents of an affected system's memory.

To exploit the vulnerability, an authenticated attacker would need to run a specially crafted application.

The update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how the .NET Framework handles objects in memory.

item.title: CVE-2020-0646|2024-08-04T06:11:05.635Z -- microsoft -- microsoft%20.net%20framework%204.6%2F4.6.1%2F4.6.2%2F4.7%2F4.7.1%2F4.7.2
item.description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when the Microsoft .NET Framework fails to validate input properly, aka '.NET Framework Remote Code Execution Injection Vulnerability'.
